summary.intent: Optimize dashboard rendering performance across 6 frontend components by reducing animation delays, simplifying effects, lowering rendering costs, and adding Suspense boundaries.
summary.outcome: Successfully applied all performance optimizations: reduced 3D scene DPR and particle count, removed stagger delays from animations across multiple components, simplified CypherText to only animate on hover, optimized FPS counter implementation, increased ping measurement interval, and added Suspense boundaries to dashboard page.

repo: The dashboard uses Framer Motion extensively with staggered animation delays that create perceived jank on initial render
The 3D GlobalNetwork scene was using frameloop='demand' incorrectly with OrbitControls autoRotate and useFrame animations, which require frameloop='always'
CypherText component was animating on mount for all 11 sidebar items, causing initial render performance issues

code.finding: Canvas with frameloop='demand' doesn't render when using autoRotate OrbitControls + useFrame animations - needs frameloop='always'. Also dpr capped at 1.5 instead of 2 saves 44% pixels on retina displays
Mount animation via useEffect with animate() call creates jank when many instances render simultaneously. Better pattern: instant text on mount, animate only on hover or explicit trigger
FPS counter pattern: use requestAnimationFrame loop to count frames, setInterval(1000) to update display - separates measurement from display update frequency

workflow: Read all files fully before making changes to understand dependencies and current state
Linters may flag unused variables after performance optimizations remove index-dependent delays - clean these up

friction: MonitoringClient file was modified by linter during edits, requiring re-read and re-application of remaining changes
Linter flagged unused 'index' parameter in ServerCard after removing stagger delays, requiring additional cleanup
